wikipedia_page.main:
Dorothy MacLeish, née Black (27 March 1890 in Bradford, Yorkshire, England, UK – 1977 in Scotland, UK) was a British journalist and writer of over 100 romance novels and several short stories from 1916 to 1974 under her maiden name Dorothy Black and as Peter Delius. In 1934 published anonymously Letters of an Indian Judge to an English Gentlewoman, later reedited under her name.  She wrote her auto-biography "The Foot of the Rainbow" in 1960.
Dorothy Black was vice-president of the Romantic Novelists' Association.
